events.name: Global Azure Bootcamp 2016 in Singapore
events.description: Welcome to Global Azure Bootcamp! On, Saturday, April 16, 2016 we are out to set some records again! The story about #GlobalAzure is as unique as it is grand. Each year hundreds of organizers around the globe arrange Azure user group events on the same day.  April of 2013 we held the first Global Windows Azure Bootcamp at more than 90 locations around the globe. In March 2014 we topped that with 136 locations, and then again last year in 2015 we hit 182 locations! This year we are again doing a one day deep dive class to help thousands of people get up to speed on developing Cloud Computing Applications for Azure.  Agenda... (http://singapore.azurebootcamp.net/)  Lucky Draw Prizes...  - Parallels Desktop for Mac - Aspose.Total Product Family - Redgate SQL Source Control and more surprise take-aways.. Singapore Website: http://singapore.azurebootcamp.net/ #GlobalAzure web site!  (http://global.azurebootcamp.net/)  For last 3 years event photos:  https://www.facebook.com/media/set/?set=a.695328410510295.1073741828.154449811264827&type=3 https://www.facebook.com/media/set/?set=a.536488169727654.1073741825.154449811264827&type=3 https://www.facebook.com/media/set/?set=a.903745209668613.1073741832.154449811264827&type=3
events.location: Microsoft Auditorium (Singapore), One Marina Boulevard, Level 21 Auditorium, Singapore 018989

events.name: FPV Race
events.description:
I'll be running two classes of race: • Micro - max 3" propellors • Open - anything goes 



There's no prizes for either of these races, they're just for fun and bragging rights.  The Micro race is a test bed for our May 7th prize race (http://www.meetup.com/dronesg/events/230116903/)  - first prize will be the brand new AirbladeX 130 X-Racer frame - a 130mm perfect-X! https://www.airbladeuav.com/products/airbladex-130-x-racer-3k-carbon-fiber-frame 


Timetable is as follows: 2:30-3:30 - Race registrations and free-fly (coordinate frequencies amongst yourselves)  Register with me so that I can figure out the round-robins etc... 3:30-5:30 - Racing - please don't fly / switch-on during other people's flights while we are racing.  Frequencies will be assigned to each racer - as per frequency info below.  You will need to change your frequency between races - so make sure you have your Transmitter & Receiver frequency tables handy, and be able to modify your frequency quickly. Racing will likely be in a round-robin format so you'll have multiple heats.  If we get more than 3 heats per racer, then we'll run a 'discard' rule that drops your lowest position, and proceed with the top three results into a final race.  Roughly following sailing fleet racing scoring practices. 5:30 onwards - free fly and packing up.  Help with collecting cones & flags etc.. is always gratefully received :) Race Frequencies • 5725 or below • 5800 or Raceband 5 • 5880 or above Each race will use the above three frequency allocations, where a range is specified you may use any available frequency available in that range, except for 5645 and 5945.  Don't forget to alter both your Tx and Rx.  When your Tx must be powered on to change frequency - wait until your heat is being setup and change your frequency while your competitors are getting ready.  Once your quad is ready and your frequency is set, please indicate that to the organiser and your fellow competitors.  Once all three competitors are ready we will double check the video feed before going into the launch sequence. 


Look forward to seeing you all tomorrow, get those lipos charged!
events.location: Behind Outram Park MRT, 1A Pearl Bank, Singapore
